computeClaimableAmountAndFee(address,uin.details: This function calculates fees by prioritizing specific fee configurations in the following order:     contract-level fees (highest priority), instance-level fees, user-specific fees, and default fees (lowest     priority).

params._claimedAmount: The initial claimed amount before fees.
params._contractId: The specific contract ID within the proxy instance.
params._contractor: The address of the contractor claiming the amount.
params._feeConfig: The fee configuration to determine which fees to deduct.
params._instance: The address of the deployed proxy instance (e.g., EscrowFixedPrice or EscrowMilestone).

returns.claimableAmount: The amount claimable after fees are deducted.
returns.clientFee: The additional fee amount covered by the client if applicable.
returns.feeDeducted: The amount of fees deducted from the claim.

computeDepositAmountAndFee(address,uint2.details: This function calculates fees by prioritizing specific fee configurations in the following order:      contract-level fees (highest priority), instance-level fees, user-specific fees, and default fees (lowest     priority).

params._client: The address of the client paying the deposit.
params._contractId: The specific contract ID within the proxy instance, if applicable, for contract-level fee     overrides.
params._depositAmount: The initial deposit amount before fees.
params._feeConfig: The fee configuration to determine which fees to apply.
params._instance: The address of the deployed proxy instance (e.g., EscrowHourly or EscrowMilestone).

returns.feeApplied: The amount of fees added to the deposit.
returns.totalDepositAmount: The total amount after fees are added.

constructor.details: Sets initial default fees on contract deployment.

params._owner: Address of the initial owner of the fee manager contract.

getApplicableFees(address,uint256,addres.details: This function returns the highest-priority fee rates among contract-specific, instance-specific,      user-specific, or default fees based on the configured hierarchy.

params._contractId: The unique identifier for the contract to which the fees apply.
params._instance: The address of the instance under which the contract falls.
params._user: The address of the user involved in the transaction.

returns._0: The applicable `FeeRates` structure containing the coverage and claim fee rates.

params._contractId: The unique identifier for the contract whose fees are being reset.
params._instance: The address of the instance containing the contract to be reset.
params._user: The address of the user whose fees are being reset.

params._contractId: The unique identifier for the contract whose fees are being reset.
params._instance: The address of the instance under which the contract falls.
The address of the instance for which fees are being reset.

params._user: The address of the user whose fees are being reset.

params._claim: Specific claim fee percentage for the contract.
params._contractId: The ID of the contract within the instance.
params._coverage: Specific coverage fee percentage for the contract.
params._instance: The address of the instance containing the contract.

params._claim: Specific claim fee percentage for the instance.
params._coverage: Specific coverage fee percentage for the instance.
params._instance: The address of the instance for which to set specific fees.

params._claim: Specific claim fee percentage for the user.
params._coverage: Specific coverage fee percentage for the user.
params._user: The address of the user for whom to set specific fees.

MAX_BPS().notice: The maximum allowable percentage in basis points (100%).

computeClaimableAmountAndFee(address,uin.notice: Calculates the claimable amount after any applicable fees based on the fee configuration.

computeDepositAmountAndFee(address,uint2.notice: Calculates the total deposit amount including any applicable fees based on the fee configuration.

contractSpecificFees(address,uint256).notice: Mapping from instance addresses to a mapping of contract IDs to their specific fee rates (1st priority).

defaultFees().notice: The default fees applied if no special fees are set (4th priority).

getApplicableFees(address,uint256,addres.notice: Retrieves the applicable fee rates based on priority for a given contract, instance, and user.

instanceFees(address).notice: Mapping from instance addresses (proxies) to their specific fee rates (2nd priority).

resetAllToDefault(address,uint256,addres.notice: Resets all higher-priority fees (contract, instance, and user-specific fees) to default in a single     call.

resetContractSpecificFees(address,uint25.notice: Resets contract-specific fees to default by removing the fee entry for a given contract ID.

resetInstanceSpecificFees(address).notice: Resets instance-specific fees to default by removing the fee entry for the given instance.

resetUserSpecificFees(address).notice: Resets user-specific fees to default by removing the fee entry for the specified user.

setContractSpecificFees(address,uint256,.notice: Sets specific fee rates for a particular contract ID within an instance.

setDefaultFees(uint16,uint16).notice: Updates the default coverage and claim fees.

setInstanceFees(address,uint16,uint16).notice: Sets specific fee rates for an instance (proxy).

setUserSpecificFees(address,uint16,uint1.notice: Sets specific fee rates for a user.

userSpecificFees(address).notice: Mapping from user addresses to their specific fee rates (3rd priority).

@notice Mapping from instance addresses to a mapping of contract IDs to their specific fee rates (1st priority).

@dev Retrieves applicable fees with the following priority:
 Contract-specific > Instance-specific > User-specific > Default.

@title Escrow Fee Manager
 @notice Manages fee rates and calculations for escrow transactions.
